1895-09-16 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 4 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • 4 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Della Plumstone should Della Plumstone should purchase the fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. It is beneficial to both because Della Plumstone can resell the fruit for a profit, and Cedric Meadowbrook can sell all of his fruit at once.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Della Plumstone offered to buy all of Cedric's fruit for a fair price because she believes she can resell it for a profit.
          Previous Summary
        • Della Plumstone proposed a deal of 3 coins to Lennon Figtree, but Lennon Figtree rejected the offer, causing the deal to fall through and Della Plumstone to lose 0 coins. Della Plumstone is now trying to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook and is negotiating a price. Della Plumstone plans to sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town. Cedric Meadowbrook agreed to sell the fruit to Della Plumstone.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'm happy to take all the fruit you have. I can offer you a fair price for it, and I know I can sell it for a profit back home.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Della Plumstone offered to buy all of Cedric's fruit for a fair price because she believes she can resell it for a profit.

Cedric Meadowbrook agreed to sell the fruit to Della Plumstone. Della Plumstone offered to buy all of Cedric's fruit for a fair price because she believes she can resell it for a profit.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone should Della Plumstone should purchase the fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. It is beneficial to both because Della Plumstone can resell the fruit for a profit, and Cedric Meadowbrook can sell all of his fruit at once.

          (a) 4 coins
          (b) 2 coins
          (c) 3 coins
          (d) 1 coin
          (e) 5 coins
          Answer: (a)

Della Plumstone is currently negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree for some fruit, intending to resell them for 6 coins in her hometown. Lennon Figtree claims his peaches are the "finest in all of Fruitville" and that Della "won't find a sweeter bite anywhere else.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: accept
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • accept
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those peaches are truly magnificent, but six coins is a bit steep for me.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "These peaches, Della, are the finest in all of Fruitville. Grown with care and ripened to perfection. You won't find a sweeter, juicier peach anywhere else in town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, those peaches look mighty fine, but I can only offer you 4 coins for the lot.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, those are prime peaches, worth at least 6 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 4.0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 5 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these peaches are the finest in all of Fruitville. You won't find a sweeter bite anywhere else.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, these peaches look delicious, but 6 coins is a bit steep for me. How about I offer you 4 coins? That way, I can still make a little profit when I sell them back home, and you'll get a good price for your hard work.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Alright, you got yourself a deal, Della.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'm happy to take all the fruit you have. I can offer you a fair price for it, and I know I can sell it for a profit back home.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
          Current time: 1895-09-16 00:10:00.


          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the market and has received an offer of 4 coins from Della Plumstone for all of his fruit.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'm happy to take all the fruit you have. I can offer you a fair price for it, and I know I can sell it for a profit back home.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept or reject Della Plumstone's offer.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • accept
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          (a) reject
          (b) accept

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell his fruit at the market and has an offer of 4 coins from Della Plumstone.
          Query
        • Cedric Meadowbrook, Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell his fruit at the market and has an offer of 4 coins from Della Plumstone.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Cedric Meadowbrook to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- 1 coin
    Event statement
  • 1 coin
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: 1 coin
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • 1 coin
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to offer Cedric Meadowbrook 4 coins for the peaches.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "These peaches, Della, are the finest in all of Fruitville. Grown with care and ripened to perfection. You won't find a sweeter, juicier peach anywhere else in town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those peaches are truly magnificent, but six coins is a bit steep for me.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, those peaches look mighty fine, but I can only offer you 4 coins for the lot.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, those are prime peaches, worth at least 6 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 5 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Lennon Figtree stands to make profit of 1.0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, these peaches look delicious, but 6 coins is a bit steep for me. How about I offer you 4 coins? That way, I can still make a little profit when I sell them back home, and you'll get a good price for your hard work.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these peaches are the finest in all of Fruitville. You won't find a sweeter bite anywhere else.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Alright, you got yourself a deal, Della.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'm happy to take all the fruit you have. I can offer you a fair price for it, and I know I can sell it for a profit back home.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, those peaches look mighty fine, but I can only offer you 4 coins for the lot.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Four coins it is then, Lennon. A deal's a deal.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-17 00:10:00.


          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook at the Fruitville market and has successfully negotiated a price of 4 coins.

          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to offer Cedric Meadowbrook 4 coins for the peaches.

          Value
        • 1 coin
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 17 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook at the Fruitville market and has successfully negotiated a price of 4 coins.

          Recalled memories and observations: [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, those peaches look mighty fine, but I can only offer you 4 coins for the lot.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to offer Cedric Meadowbrook 4 coins for the peaches.

          Question: What price would Lennon Figtree propose?:
          (a) 1 coin
          (b) 5 coins
          (c) 3 coins
          (d) 2 coins
          (e) 4 coins
          Answer: (a)

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is a merchant who buys and sells fruit in the market square. He recently made a profit from a deal with Della Plumstone and is currently negotiating a price for peaches with Lennon Figtree.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, those are prime peaches, worth at least 6 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept or reject Lennon Figtree's offer of 1 coin for the peaches.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to reject the offer.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (a)

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, he discovered a hidden grove bursting with wild strawberries. He carefully picked the ripest berries and, with a touch of theatricality, convinced his neighbors they were a rare and delicious variety from a distant land. His sales were brisk, leaving Cedric with a pocketful of coins and a growing sense of satisfaction.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he apprenticed with a traveling fruit vendor, eager to learn the tricks of the trade. He quickly grasped the importance of presentation, carefully arranging the fruit to create an enticing display and spinning tales of their origins to captivate customers. Cedric excelled at his craft, but a nagging voice whispered that he was merely imitating, not truly creating.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he struck out on his own, his cart laden with a diverse array of fruits. He traveled from town to town, his charm and persuasive skills earning him a loyal clientele. Yet, Cedric found himself constantly moving, avoiding long-term commitments and deeper connections, fearing the vulnerability they might bring.

[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these are the finest peaches in all of Fruitville. You won't find a sweeter bite anywhere else.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, your peaches are truly beautiful, the finest in Fruitville, but six coins is a bit steep for me.
